titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Patricia Evans Collection of New York City Photographic Slides
1957, 1959
PR 407
titlestmt.author: Larry Weimer

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 15:50:44 -0400.

did.unittitle: Patricia Evans collection of New York City photographic slides
did.abstract: About 107 color photographic slides, primarily of New York City. The bulk are from 1957; 9 are from 1959. The images include views from the Empire State Building and from a Hudson River ferry, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Central Park, Chrysler Building, the United Nations, an Automat display, and the Battery, Wall Street, and other lower Manhattan locations. About 9 are of Bear Mountain State Park.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The slides are in their original boxes, with each of the 5 boxes having a list with some identifying information. The 5 boxes are boxed together in one larger archival box.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available by advance appointment only. To schedule an appointment, contact the Print Room Librarian at printroom@nyhistory.org.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)

Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org 212-485-9228 .

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: This collection should be cited as the Patricia Evans collection of New York City photographic slldes, PR 407, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, New-York Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by archivist Larry Weimer, December 2019.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection includes about 107 color photographic slides, primarily of New York City. About 9 are of Bear Mountain State Park. The bulk are from 1957; 9 are from 1959. The images include views from the Empire State Building and from a Hudson River ferry, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Central Park, Chrysler Building, the United Nations, an Automat display, and the Battery, Wall Street, and other lower Manhattan locations.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The lists of slides included in the collection refer to various locales that are no longer in the boxes. Some of these refer to Asbury Park, New Jersey, indicating it was "home." That suggests that these images were taken by someone making occasional day trips to New York City. It is not known if the donor, Patricia Evans, was the photographer or someone she knew or was related to.
